result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (8th) and Operating w/ PAC (8th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (8th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (8th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Jason J Pollock was found guilty of OWI (8th), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concur to cts 1, 11 and 12 in case 16CF171.  Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

superMiscConds.notes: $250 DNA surcharge and court costs remitted. $92 VW surcharge paid in full from bond.

Defendant shall not use/possess alcohol, drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.   Do not drive a motor vehicle without valid DL and approval of agent & any alcohol in system.
Shall be in alcohol support, treatment or counseling entire time on ES or probation.

supervisions.notes: IID restriction effective upon licensure for 36 mo.

Based on financial information provided to the Court by the defendant, the Court has found that the defendant's household income is no more than 150% of the federal nonfarm poverty guideline.
Therefore it is Ordered that an Ignition Interlock Device (IID) shall be installed and maintained for 50% of the normal costs.
